Farmer Name: Farmer Code: Farmer Birthday Year:> Gender: Educational Level: Village: House GPS: Get Location Postal Address: Phone Number: Years Relationship With Mars: Have spouse: Spouse Name: Spouse Birthday Year: Spouse Educational Level: Total number of children: Children between 5 and 17 years old: Children between 5 and 17 years old enrolled in school: Number of Family members living together including the farmer: Farmer group Family members work on farm: Number of family members depend on family income: Farmer receives payment for other work: Net Income from all other work that farmer does in the past year: Spouse have any paid work other than working on own cocoa farm: Spouse Net Income from all work other than working on own cocoa farm: Family Members contributed with money to the household: Net money contributed from family members to the household: Have Additional Crops: Net Income from all other crops in the past year (Year means past two seasons, mid and main crop): Have you taken a loan over 5M IDR that you have to pay back? What is the total amount of the loan outstanding? Where did you take the loan from: How often do you pay back? How much do you pay back? Have you given someone a loan over 5M IDR? What is the total amount of the loan outstanding you give? How much they pay back? Household Savings: Annual living expenses: Annual other expenses: Planned investments: Expected education expenses: Have bank account? Account Type Farmer account have Mobile money option? Want a bank account? Total Kg Production of cocoa in crop year or calendar year: Average Farm gate cocoa price per Kg: Total Expenses on cocoa last year (Year means past two seasons, mid and main crop): Gross Income from Cocoa in the past year (Year means past two seasons, mid and main crop): Year of farm establishment: Farm Certifications: Total land ownership or availability Size (Ha): Total land under cultivation Size (Ha): Total land under cocoa Size (Ha): Total Renovation Size (Ha): Additional Crops: Hire labor: How many labor days hire: Number of plots:
Plot GPS: Plot Size (Ha): Estimated production: Number of Shade trees: Soil PH: Planting Material: Distance between cocoa trees: Tree age: Tree health: Debilitating Disease: Pruning: Pest and Disease and Sanitation: Weeding: Harvesting: Shade Management: Soil Condition: Organic Matter: Fertilizer Formulation: Fertilizer Application: Lime need: Drainage need: Filling in/out option: Hire labor: Genetics: Farm Condition: GAPS: Soil Fertility Management: Calculate

Farmer Name and Farmer Code cannot be empty! Save successful! Autosaved Clearing Drainage Lining-cocoa and shade Cocoa Planting Cocoa re- or inter-planting Coconut leaf - temporary shade Shade Planting Pruning/Sanitation Fertilizer Grafting work/ take off the plastic Pollarding/Sanitation, cutting old tree after grafting Herbiciding OR mechanical manual weeding Circle weeding Fertilizing NPK, Cocoa Fertilizer, foliar at planting Application of lime, organic fertilizer P and D Control + Foliar Pruning/Sanitation Shape pruning Maintenance Production/shape/Reducing mother trees branches Sanitation Shape pruning Shade reducing/rejuvenate old shade Harvest, ferment, dry, sell This includes paid labor on other farms, nursery, other business or services that bring in money into the farmer household This includes paid labor on other farms, sales from other business or services for other people that bring in money into the household This includes all money that is available to family excluding that from farmer and spouse. Money can be from brothers, sisters, parents or other family members who can be living in home or sending from other village, city or country Conversion ratio for Wet to Dry is 100:35 or 35% This is educational expense post secondary schooling and/or beyond normal schooling expense Farm expenses include all expenses incurred in the production, fermentation, storage and sale of cocoa. Please account for all inputs, labor payments etc
